clinical_study.brief_title: Selective Caries vs Stepwise Caries Removal Technique in Deep Carious Lesions
clinical_study.official_title: Success of Selective Caries vs Stepwise Caries Removal Technique in Deep Carious Lesions- A Randomized Clinical Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Postgraduate Institute of Dental Sciences Rohtak

clinical_study.source: Postgraduate Institute of Dental Sciences Rohtak

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this clinical study is to compare and evaluate the Success of Selective Caries vs Stepwise Caries Removal Techniques in treatment of dental caries.

detailed_description.textblock: The patient will be selected as per the pre-defined eligibility criteria. Written informed consent will be taken from each consenting participant. Initial caries excavation will be done under rubber dam isolation. The patient will then be randomly allocated to two groups: selective removal to soft dentin or stepwise caries removal. Composite restoration with glass ionomer liner will be then placed in both groups. Additional complete caries excavation will be done in the stepwise caries removal group after six months.

primary_outcome.description: Clinical success will be judged by following criteria Positive response on vitality test. Absence of pain on percussion and any other signs and/or symptoms of irreversible pulpitis and pulp necrosis Criteria for failure will be Negative response on pulp vitality test. Tenderness to percussion and teeth exhibiting any clinical signs and/or symptoms of irreversible pulpitis and pulp necrosis.

secondary_outcome.description: Absence of periapical alterations (radiolucency at furcal or periapical region).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Selective caries removal to soft dentin (one step)
arm_group.description: In selective caries removal to soft dentine, after caries excavation application of liner will be done on pulpal floor. Teeth will then be filled with composite resin material.

The stepwise caries removal is a two step procedure. The first step is similar to selective caries removal to soft dentin group. In the second step, after 6 months lesion will be re-entered to remove remaining carious tissue till firm dentin is encountered. Once all the caries is removed from floor of cavity a liner followed by final restoration with composite will be performed.

intervention.description: After caries removal restoration of tooth will be performed
intervention.arm_group_label: Selective caries removal to soft dentin (one step)

intervention.description: After caries removal restoration of tooth will be performed

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Outpatient in age range of 18yr-60yr
- Permanent mandibular posterior teeth with deep caries
- Caries extending to >3/4 of dentin with a layer of sound dentin between pulp and carious tissue as seen on radiograph
- Positive response to cold test and electric pulp test
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any general disease affecting the caries e.g. patient under head and neck radiotherapy
- Patients with immuno-compromised status
- Tooth with fracture line, cracks.
